alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Gove; Graham; Logan; Norton; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 09 at 12:47PM CST until March 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Snow will begin to develop in southwest Nebraska Wednesday afternoon and gradually move south. Worst conditions are expected Wednesday night when snow and blowing snow may cause significant travel difficulties, including Interstate 70. Snow will gradually end west to east through the day on Thursday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph. Wind chill readings could drop as low as -10 to -16. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
